bar.plugin
Class ShenCastan

java.lang.Object
  bar.plugin.ShenCastan
All Implemented Interfaces:
DialogListener, ExtendedPlugInFilter, PlugInFilter
public class ShenCastan
extends Object
implements ExtendedPlugInFilter, DialogListener

Performs gradient computation using the method proposed by Shen and Castan, an alternative to Canny-Deriche filtering. For a full description, see the original manuscript: Shen and Castan, CVGIP, 1992, 54 (2) 112-133. DOI: 10.1016/1049-9652(92)90060-B 

 2014.06-2015.07, Tiago Ferreira
      - Extended API
      - Works with 16-bit and 32-bit images and stacks (multithreaded)
      - If present, only area ROI is processed
      - Added "preview" mode and undo support
      - Licensed under GPL (see ../../../../../LICENSE.txt)
 2004.07, Maxime Pinchon
      - Algorithm implementation[1]. This initial version no longer works with IJ
 
 [1] http://imagej.nih.gov/ij/plugins/inserm514/Documentation/Shen_Castan_514/Shen_Castan_514.html

findEdges

public void findEdges(ImageProcessor ip,
                      double f)
Method implementing Shen-Castan edge detection.

Parameters:
ip - the ImageProcessor to be filtered (8/16/32-bit grayscale image)
f - the smoothing factor alpha, i.e., the Shen-Castan coefficient. Can vary between 0d (high smoothing, suitable for noisy images) and 1d (no smoothing, suitable for non-noisy images). Note that no validation is performed to assess if 0d > alpha < 1d .

getX

public double[] getX()
Returns the horizontal component of the computed gradient. Must be called after calling findEdges(ImageProcessor, double).

Returns:
the horizontal component of the Shen-Castan gradient

getY

public double[] getY()
Returns the vertical component of the computed gradient. Must be called after calling findEdges(ImageProcessor, double).

Returns:
the vertical component of the Shen-Castan gradient
